channel.title: Looking For Partners
channel.description:
I am looking for partners that can help me with the development of the webclient maker. I am not the [b]best[/b] with PHP but I know enough to make this thing work enough. I am looking for about 2-3 people that are proficient in PHP and SQL. HTML & CSS are optional because I can do all of that myself.
Why am I looking for partners? Well, the webclient maker has grown up alot, I have gotten roughly 1,000 downloads so far. This is huge for me, I never though anything I have ever made would get as popular as this script has.
[b]Payment:[/b]
Sorry, no payment will be involved. MoparScape doesn't allow it and I can't afford it. These position will be purely voluntary.
[b]Contact Me: [/b]
PM me on MoparScape. Include past projects, proof of experience, etc.

item.title: Looking For Partners
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

tobias222:

I can help more than anyone, since I came up with the idea years ago, and ran the longest and most successful webclient creator script.

Vouch for him.

OT: If I could help with it I would. Making a site with a webclient maker has been something I wanted to do for a while but never got around to doing. If you want some of my ideas on how I was going to make the site successful, I’d be happy to share them with you.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking For Partners
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

tobias222:

I can help more than anyone, since I came up with the idea years ago, and ran the longest and most successful webclient creator script.

That doesn’t mean you can help more than anyone, it just means you have experience with it. His code isn’t going to be the same as yours is(was?). Anyone with a good understanding and knowledge of PHP would be as good as the next guy is :).

Read full topic
